channel.title: Huge project: Rewriting RS2 from scratch
channel.description:
Im rewriting the runescape client, it will be compatible with 317 data and protocol.
Changelog: [CODE] 4/7/2009 Implemented RSInterface 4/7/2009 Implemented a interface rendering system based upon AWT 4/8/2009 Implemented JagexImageFormat readers 4/8/2009 Implemented a basic client class. 4/8/2009 Implemented the login block 4/8/2009 Implemented a gamestate system. 4/9/2009 LoginGameState done. 4/9/2009 Login block works 4/9/2009 Incoming packet framework and isaac 4/9/2009 Implemented sendmessage 4/9/2009 Changed packethandler to use hashmaps 4/9/2009 Added a basic ingame gamestate 4/9/2009 Implemented RegionSelect packet 4/9/2009 Implemented 2D map drawer 4/9/2009 Implemented map reader and map index table 4/10/2009 Implemented this_player_movement_block 4/10/2009 Implemented other_player_movement_block 4/10/2009 Implemented add_player_block 4/10/2009 Player update sequence done. 4/10/2009 Fixed some bugs in the outgoing isaac handler 4/10/2009 Added outgoing chat block 4/10/2009 Changed how the chatbox worked. 4/11/2009 3D! [/CODE]
SVN and GoogleCode project: [url=http://code.google.com/p/rs2rewrite]http://code.google.com/p/rs2rewrite[/url]
NOTE: My name is peterbosc on there as i could not use my full name , (Peter Bjorn Bosch) Screenshot's:
3D: [IMG]http://i42.tinypic.com/2nustwy.png[/img]
Chat works: [IMG]http://i42.tinypic.com/2hfqijm.png[/img]
First ingame screenshot: [IMG]http://i41.tinypic.com/2vnf1mu.png[/img]

item.title: Huge project: Rewriting RS2 from scratch
item.dc:creator: @Freddy1990 Freddy1990
item.description:
@Freddy1990 wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:34, topic:272337”][quote author=Freddy1990 link=topic=359321.msg2758815#msg2758815 date=1240379289]

Nice work! But why java?
[/quote]Why not?

Well… If you’d for example build it in a native language you could use DirectX for graphics rendering… Of course I suppose if you want it to be cross-platform you could use OpenGL in java… Unless you won’t have requirements suited to it of course… Dunno where this project is headed…

You could use OpenGL with python or C++ to keep it cross platform as well. Bottom line is he chose java, if you would have chosen another language then do it in that language. :)[/quote]
Well yea, but I said java as he did it in java… He could’ve used Mono for that matter if eh wanted to =P

Read full topic
item.source: Huge project: Rewriting RS2 from scratch

item.title: Huge project: Rewriting RS2 from scratch
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“Freddy1990, post:28, topic:272337”][quote author=Speljohan link=topic=359321.msg2757662#msg2757662 date=1240327672]

Nice work! But why java?
[/quote]Why not?

Well… If you’d for example build it in a native language you could use DirectX for graphics rendering… Of course I suppose if you want it to be cross-platform you could use OpenGL in java… Unless you won’t have requirements suited to it of course… Dunno where this project is headed…[/quote]

You could use OpenGL with python or C++ to keep it cross platform as well. Bottom line is he chose java, if you would have chosen another language then do it in that language.

Read full topic

item.title: Huge project: Rewriting RS2 from scratch
item.dc:creator: @ilyaostr9 io9
item.description:
@ilyaostr9 wrote:

Pfft, Chef is superior to all!

en.wikipedia.org

Esoteric programming language

An esoteric programming language (sometimes shortened to esolang) is a programming language designed to test the boundaries of computer programming language design, as a proof of concept, as software art, as a hacking interface to another language (particularly functional programming or procedural programming languages), or as a joke. The use of esoteric distinguishes these languages from programming languages that working developers use to write software. Usually, an esolang's creators do not i...

Read full topic

item.title: Huge project: Rewriting RS2 from scratch
item.dc:creator: @BAsh BAsh
item.description:
@BAsh wrote:

Greeny:

I’d have used perl…

ffs i know some people love bagging java but if its a language they know already, a language that most of the forum knows already and a language that the rs client is built on (the very thing you are rewriting) then it is the best language to use.

stop giving us crap about java being slow, the language being ugly or any other complaint you have in your biased world and get over it.
